title: Lennard-Jones Liquid Simulation
description: Molecular dynamics simulation of Lennard-Jones liquid with configurable thermodynamic ensembles, temperature control, optional Radial Distribution Function (RDF) analysis, and comprehensive thermodynamic property calculations.
content:
🧪 Overview

The Lennard-Jones Liquid Simulation provides a fundamental molecular dynamics platform for studying liquid-state behavior using the classical Lennard-Jones potential. This simulation enables exploration of thermodynamic properties, phase transitions, and structural dynamics in simple atomic liquids.

🔬 Scientific Background

The Lennard-Jones (LJ) potential is one of the most widely used models in molecular simulations, representing the interaction between neutral atoms or molecules. It captures both the attractive van der Waals forces at medium range and the repulsive forces at short range due to electron cloud overlap.

The LJ potential is given by:

V(r) = 4ε[(σ/r)¹² - (σ/r)⁶]

where ε is the depth of the potential well and σ is the distance at which the potential is zero.

🎯 Main Capabilities

FeatureDescription
Ensemble ControlChoose between NVE (microcanonical), NVT (canonical), or NPT (isothermal-isobaric) ensembles

💡 Tip: For accurate thermodynamic properties, ensure your equilibration period is sufficiently long (typically 10-20% of production run). Monitor energy drift in NVE simulations to verify integration accuracy.

🎓 Phase Diagram Reference

The Lennard-Jones fluid has been extensively studied as a model system in statistical mechanics. Key thermodynamic states:

Phase StateT* (Temperature)ρ* (Density)Characteristics
Triple Point≈ 0.68≈ 0.85Solid-liquid-gas coexistence
Critical Point≈ 1.32≈ 0.32Liquid-gas phase boundary ends
Liquid Range0.7 - 1.30.7 - 0.95Typical liquid state region
Gas Range> 1.5< 0.3Low density gas phase
Solid Range< 0.7> 1.0Crystalline solid phase

These parameters provide reference points for exploring different thermodynamic states and phase transitions.

jobConfig.label: System Size
jobConfig.name: system_size
jobConfig.description: Choose computing resources based on your system size. Larger systems require more computational power.

spec.label: Simulation Folder
spec.name: simulationFolder
spec.description: Directory to store simulation scripts and output data. Results will be saved here.

spec.label: Number of Atoms
spec.name: numAtoms
spec.description: Total number of atoms in the simulation box. Larger systems provide better statistics but require more computational resources.

spec.label: Reduced Density (ρ*)
spec.name: density
spec.description: Reduced density ρ* = ρσ³. Typical liquid: 0.7-0.9, gas: <0.3. Higher density = denser packing.

spec.label: Reduced Temperature (T*)
spec.name: temperature
spec.description: Reduced temperature T* = kᵦT/ε. Liquid range: 0.7-1.5, critical point: ~1.32. Higher values = more kinetic energy.

spec.label: Ensemble Type
spec.name: ensemble
spec.description: Statistical ensemble for the simulation. NVE: constant energy (no thermostat), NVT: constant temperature, NPT: constant pressure and temperature.

spec.label: Calculate Temperature
spec.name: calculateTemp
spec.description: Enable real-time temperature calculation and output. Useful for monitoring thermal equilibration and thermostat performance.

spec.label: Calculate RDF
spec.name: calculateRDF
spec.description: Enable Radial Distribution Function (RDF) calculation and output. Generates rdf.dat file for analyzing structural properties and particle correlations in the liquid.

spec.label: Cutoff Radius (rc/σ)
spec.name: cutoff
spec.description: Interaction cutoff distance in units of σ. Standard value: 2.5-3.0. Larger cutoff = more accurate but slower.

spec.label: Timestep (Δt)
spec.name: timestep
spec.description: Integration timestep in reduced units (τ = σ√(m/ε)). Typical: 0.001-0.005. Smaller timestep = more accurate but slower.

spec.label: Equilibration Steps
spec.name: equilSteps
spec.description: Number of timesteps for equilibration before data collection. Recommended: 10000-50000 to ensure proper equilibration.

spec.label: Production Steps
spec.name: prodSteps
spec.description: Number of timesteps for production run (data collection). More steps = better statistics. Recommended: 50000-200000.

spec.label: Output Frequency
spec.name: outputFreq
spec.description: Write trajectory and thermodynamic data every N timesteps. Lower values = more detailed output but larger files.
